elements.title: Maria Comnena (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Queen Maria Comnena (pictured) abducted her daughter and coerced her into divorcing to place her on the throne of Jerusalem?

elements.title: NZS 3604 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that technical standard NZS 3604 is used to design and construct about 93 per cent of New Zealand's light timber-framed buildings?

elements.title: Geoffrey Guy (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Geoffrey Guy's company GW Pharmaceuticals was the first to obtain regulatory approval for a medicine based on cannabis?

elements.title: Hermann Boeschenstein (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that University of Toronto professor Hermann Boeschenstein published two novels during his lifetime, 56 years apart?

elements.title: London Boy (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Taylor Swift song "London Boy" features a spoken-word intro by English actor Idris Elba?

elements.title: black-and-red broadbill (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the black-and-red broadbill lays eggs in three color morphs?

elements.title: Donald Mastick (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Donald Mastick accidentally swallowed plutonium in August 1944, and his breath became radioactive?

elements.title: Piano Sonata No. 31 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the finale of Beethoven's Piano Sonata No. 31 sees a gradual "return to life" and ends with a "passionate" and "heroic" coda?
